org.openimaj.image.processing.face.recognition

Class FaceRecognitionEngine<FACE extends DetectedFace,PERSON>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.processing.face.recognition.FaceRecognitionEngine<FACE,PERSON>
  • Type Parameters:
    FACE - Type of DetectedFace
    PERSON - Type representing a person
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.openimaj.io.ReadableBinary, org.openimaj.io.ReadWriteableBinary, org.openimaj.io.WriteableBinary

    public class FaceRecognitionEngine<FACE extends DetectedFace,PERSON>
extends Object
implements org.openimaj.io.ReadWriteableBinary
    The FaceRecognitionEngine ties together the implementations of a FaceDetector and FaceRecogniser, and provides a single convenience API with which to interact with a face recognition system.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      • train

        public void train(org.openimaj.data.dataset.GroupedDataset<PERSON,org.openimaj.data.dataset.ListDataset<org.openimaj.image.FImage>,org.openimaj.image.FImage> dataset)
        Train with a dataset

      • train

        public FACE train(PERSON person,
         org.openimaj.image.FImage image)
        Train the recogniser with a single example, returning the detected face. If multiple faces are found, the biggest is chosen.

        If you need more control, consider calling getDetector() to get a detector which you can apply to your image and getRecogniser() to get the recogniser which you can train with the detections directly.

        Parameters:
        person - the person
        image - the image with the persons face
        Returns:
        the detected face

      • train

        public FACE train(FACE face,
         PERSON person)
        Train for the given face patch without doing any face detection. It is assumed that the given image will be a cropped/aligned image of the face as is necessary for the given recogniser.
        Parameters:
        face - The detected face implementation
        person - The person to whom this face belongs
        Returns:
        The face image

      • recognise

        public List<org.openimaj.util.pair.IndependentPair<FACE,List<ScoredAnnotation<PERSON>>>> recognise(org.openimaj.image.FImage image)
        Detect and recognise the faces in the given image, returning a list of potential people for each face.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a list of faces and recognitions

        Parameters:
        image - the image
        Returns:
        a list of faces with the most likely person

      • recognise

        public List<org.openimaj.util.pair.IndependentPair<FACE,List<ScoredAnnotation<PERSON>>>> recognise(org.openimaj.image.FImage image,
                                                                                          Set<PERSON> restrict)
        Detect and recognise the faces in the given image, returning a list of potential people for each face. The recognised people will be restricted to the given set.
        Parameters:
        image - the image
        restrict - set of people to restrict to
        Returns:
        a list of faces and recognitions

      • recogniseBest

                                                                                        Set<PERSON> restrict)
        Detect and recognise the faces in the given image, returning the most likely person for each face. The recognised people will be restricted to the given set.
        Parameters:
        image - the image
        restrict - set of people to restrict to
        Returns:
        a list of faces with the most likely person
